Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; quite flat shoulder area with sharp turn to the body; interior reserved; exterior,white slip: from top: horizontal festoon-pattern with dots, leftward open cable-pattern with dots framed by double lines, network of blobs; painted area on the left of the decorated field.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Venit, M. S. 'Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums'. 1988, nos. 153-154.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.034)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
